Key Arguments: The legislation would create a government-controlled authority that determines what can be shared on digital platforms, which is seen as a threat to free speech.
Such a mechanism would lead to a divided, oppressive, and dystopian society.
The bill is viewed as an attempt to stifle opposition and enforce a single, government-approved narrative.
The legislation could hinder inventiveness and progressive development by suppressing diverse opinions and challenges.
Notable Quotes: The establishment of such a mechanism and authority to veto free speech and determine what is truth by any government is guaranteed to create a divided, oppressive and dystopian society.
To pass such a bill into law is an attempt to stifle and silence any opposition to the governing authorityâ€™s predominant narrative.
